de.mrapp.android.dialog

Class AbstractMaterialDialogFragment

  • java.lang.Object
    • de.mrapp.android.dialog.AbstractMaterialDialogFragment
  • Direct Known Subclasses:
    AbstractHeaderDialogFragment

    public abstract class AbstractMaterialDialogFragment
extends java.lang.Object
    An abstract base class for all dialogs, which are designed according to Android 5's Material design guidelines even on pre-Lollipop devices and are able to show fragments.
    Since:
    3.2.0

    • Constructor Summary

      Constructors 
      Constructor and Description
      AbstractMaterialDialogFragment()
      Creates a dialog, which is designed according to Android 5's Material Design guidelines even on pre-Lollipop devices and is able to show fragments.

      • AbstractMaterialDialogFragment

        public AbstractMaterialDialogFragment()
        Creates a dialog, which is designed according to Android 5's Material Design guidelines even on pre-Lollipop devices and is able to show fragments.

    • Method Detail

      • setThemeResourceId

        protected final void setThemeResourceId(@StyleRes
                                        int themeResourceId)
        Sets the resource id of the theme, which should be used by the dialog.
        Parameters:
        themeResourceId - The resource id of the theme, which should be used by the dialog, as an Integer value. The resource id must correspond to a valid theme

      • setContext

        protected final void setContext(@NonNull
                                Context context)
        Sets the context, which should be used by the dialog.
        Parameters:
        context - The context, which should be set, as an instance of the class Context. The context may not be null

      • onAttachDecorators

        @CallSuper
protected void onAttachDecorators(@NonNull
                                             View view,
                                             @NonNull
                                             android.support.v4.app.FragmentManager fragmentManager)
        The method, which is invoked when the dialog's decorators should be attached. This method may be overridden by subclasses in order to attach additional decorators.
        Parameters:
        view - The root view of the view hierarchy, which should be modified by the decorators, as an instance of the class View. The view may not be null
        fragmentManager - The fragment manager, which can be used to show fragment within the dialog, as an instance of the class FragmentManager. The fragment manager may not be null

      • onDetachDecorators

        @CallSuper
protected void onDetachDecorators()
        The method, which is invoked when the dialog's decorators should be detached. This method must be overridden by subclasses if they attach additional decorators.

      • onRestoreInstanceState

        @CallSuper
protected void onRestoreInstanceState(@NonNull
                                                 Bundle savedInstanceState)
        The method, which is invoked when the dialog is re-created in order to restore its state. This method may be overridden by subclasses in order to restore the properties, which are stored in the onSaveInstanceState-method.
        Parameters:
        savedInstanceState - The bundle, which has been used to store the state, as an instance of the class Bundle. The bundle may not be null
